question: COBRA Coverage and Options Through Virginia's Insurance Marketplace
text:
COBRA Coverage and Options Through Virginia's Insurance Marketplace
          
        
When you lose job-based insurance, you may be offered COBRA continuation coverage by your former employer.


If youre losing job-based coverage and havent signed up for COBRA, learn about your rights and options under COBRA from the
State Commission Corporation
.



You can also elect to enroll in a plan through Virginia's Insurance Marketplace, and you may be eligible for financial assistance to lower the cost of coverage. Losing job-based coverage qualifies you for a Special Enrollment Period. This means you have 60 days to enroll in a health plan, even if its outside the annual
Open Enrollment Period
.


You can also browse plans to see what is available in your area before you decide. Use our
anonymous shopping
tool to see the plans available to you, and if you qualify for financial
assistance! If you already have COBRA coverage
Even if youre already enrolled in COBRA, you may have options to enroll in coverage through Virginia's Insurance Marketplace.
"Can you change from COBRA to a plan through Virginia's Insurance Marketplace?"
" ","If your COBRA is running out","If youre ending COBRA early","If your COBRA costs change because your former employer stops contributing  and you must pay full cost"
"During Open Enrollment (Nov. 1  Jan. 15)","Yes  you can change.","Yes  you can change.","Yes  you can change."
"Outside Open Enrollment","Yes  you can change  you qualify for a Special Enrollment Period.","No  you cant change until the next Open Enrollment Period  your COBRA runs out  or you qualify for a Special Enrollment Period another way.","Yes  you can change  you qualify for a Special Enrollment Period."
Dont forget  Open Enrollment begins November 1 and ends January 15!
